meanings.definition: Showing excessive patriotism or loyalty, especially to one's own country.
meanings.sent1: He proudly waved the chauvinistically colored flag during the parade.
meanings.sent2: She always speaks chauvinistically about her homeland's achievements.
meanings.sent3: The cat chauvinistically guarded its territory, not letting any other animals near.
meanings.sent4: The old tree stood chauvinistically tall, overshadowing the rest of the forest.
meanings.sent5: The chef chauvinistically claimed that his country's cuisine was the best in the world.

meanings.definition: Displaying a biased or prejudiced belief in the superiority of one's own gender.
meanings.sent1: The group's leader made chauvinistically remarks about women's abilities.
meanings.sent2: Some people still hold chauvinistically views about traditional gender roles.
meanings.sent3: The robot made a chauvinistically error by assuming only men could be engineers.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered chauvinistically over the male-dominated city.
meanings.sent5: Her chauvinistically attitude towards men made it hard for her to work in a mixed-gender team.
